ygData.subject: RE: Don't laugh at this question
ygData.msgSnippet: Another spot that I found decent is at the live zone in Upper Guk. There are 2 spawns just around the corner, 3 on the next island (although 1 is always green)
ygData.messageBody:
Another spot that I found decent is at the live zone in Upper Guk. There
are 2 spawns just around the corner, 3 on the next island (although 1 is
always green) and 3 more in the Nokta room to the left of the island coming
from the zone line. (There are 3-4 more down the right hand tunnel but a
broken LoS causes problems with breaking the spawn.) I got through 35, 36,
and 37 solo here Lamenting them and pulling to the zone line. At 37 I could
rotate through all 8 for about half a bubble of experience I think. Spawn
time on each of em is about 16-17 minits.

Good Journey

Sineras Silverlyre, The Divine Alliance (Cazic-Thule)

-----Original Message-----
From: kim@... [mailto:kim@...]
Sent: Thursday, February 24, 2000 6:08 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Don't laugh at this question


From: <kim@...>

On Thu, 24 Feb 2000, Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4 wrote:
>
> Was wondering if there is a good place for me to solo at 35th level?
Spent

You could try Lower Guk, live side, near the zone. There are
a few shin-level frogs that spawn near there, and make good
charming targets (well, as good as live frogs get - they tend
to want to attack you all the time). The dead side will work
too (undead are content to attack each other), but tends to be
more train-prone.

> giants against one another. Anyone got a better suggestion. Would it
just
> be better to join a group in one of the dungeons or kill ogre bouncers?

Grouping is best. Best exp 35-40 is Mistmoore. You can get
about a bubble every hour or two there with a competent group
that knows how to work around the bugs in the zone.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
